member.name: M:Doli.DoPE.DoPE.CheckApi(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.param: DoPENet version the user wants to use
member.returns: DoPE.ERR.NOERROR: The version check has been successfully finished. DoPE.ERR.INTERNAL: An internal error has occured. DoPE.ERR.VERSION: Means, that either - the application's version does not match to the DoPENet.dll version or - the DoPENet.dll version does not match to the DoPE.dll version

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE.DoPE.CheckApi(System.String)
member.summary: Unlocks the DoPE .NET library. The stated DoPE version string is checked for equality against: - the DoPE .NET library - the DoPE C++ library (which is used by the DoPE .NET library) If these versions are equal, all library functions can be used.
member.param: The DoPE .NET library version your application wants to work with. Please provide the string in this format: "major-version-number.minor-version-number" Example: "2.70"
member.returns: DoPE.ERR.NOERROR: The version check has been successfully finished. DoPE.ERR.INTERNAL: An internal error has occured. DoPE.ERR.VERSION: Means, that either - the application's version does not match to the DoPENet.dll version or - the DoPENet.dll version does not match to the DoPE.dll version
member.remarks: The version check ensures that your application will only work with both DoPE libraries your application has been designed for.

member.name: T:Doli.DoPE.DoPE.CMC_ID
member.summary:
Constants for Calculated Sensor Init Value
The formula and used sensor are all coded in a 16Bit value: 1. For formula 0 - 6 may use three sensors: S3 S2 S1 Formula Sign ___________ ___________ ___________ ________ __ 15 14 13 12 11 10 09 08 07 06 05 04 03 02 01 00
2. For formula 7 - 23 Bits 1-3 must be "1" and the formula is in Bits 12 - 15 These extented formulas can only use two Sensors, or the sensors must be in in ascending order ExtFormula S2 S1 Value 7 Sign ___________ ___________ ___________ ________ __ 15 14 13 12 11 10 09 08 07 06 05 04 03 02 01 00

member.name: F:Doli.DoPE.DoPE.CMC_ID.S1PlusS2PlusS3PlusS4_quarter
member.summary: Sensors must be in in ascending order starting at S1 !! S = (((S1 + S2+ S3+ S4) / 4) / Corr) - Offset

member.name: F:Doli.DoPE.DoPE.CMC_ID.F_S1PlusS2PlusS3PlusS4
member.summary: Sensors must be in in ascending order starting at S1 !! S = ((S1 + S2+ S3+ S4) / Corr) - Offset

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE.DoPEcmc.ConfCMcSpeed(Doli.DoPE.DoPE.SENSOR,Doli.DoPE.DoPE.SENSOR,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Configure calculated speed to measuring data record. From any measuring channel speed (the first differentiation) may be calculated and configured to the data record. After it is configured, it may be used as the supervised channel in the command "DoPESetCheck". This command should not be used when DoPEExts2 or DoPEFDPoti command are running.
member.param: Position in measuring data record for the calculated speed value. Any value between SENSOR4 to SENSOR15 is valid.
Integration time for data acquisition (only relevant for analogue channels). Maximum 100 * cycle time of seed controller.
Time base for speed calculation. Maximum 2.56 sec.

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE.DoPEcmc.ConfCMcCommandSpeed(Doli.DoPE.DoPE.SENSOR,System.Double)
member.summary: Configure calculated speed of command output to data record. Speed of command output (the first differentiation) may be calculated and configured to the data record. After it is configured, it may be used as the supervised channel in the command "DoPESetCheck". This command should not be used when DoPEExts2 or DoPEFDPoti command are running.
member.param: Position in measuring data record for the calculated command speed.
Time base for speed calculation. Maximum 2.56 sec.

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE.DoPEcmc.ConfCMcGradient(Doli.DoPE.DoPE.SENSOR,Doli.DoPE.DoPE.SENSOR,Doli.DoPE.DoPE.SENSOR,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Configure calculated gradient between two measured values to measuring data record. A gradient between two measured values may be calculated and configured to the data record. After it is configured, it may be used as the supervised channel in the command "DoPESetCheck". This command should not be used when DoPEExts2 or DoPEFDPoti command are running.
member.param: Position in measuring data record for the calculated gradient.
Integration time for data acquisition (only relevant for analogue channels). Maximum 100 * cycle time of speed controller.
Time base for gradient calculation. Maximum 2.56 sec.

member.name: M:Doli.DoPE.DoPEcmc.ConfPeakValue(Doli.DoPE.DoPE.SENSOR,Doli.DoPE.DoPE.SENSOR,Doli.DoPE.DoPE.SENSOR,Doli.DoPE.DoPE.SENSOR,Doli.DoPE.DoPE.SENSOR,Doli.DoPE.DoPE.SENSOR)
member.summary: Configure peakvalues to measuring data record. The peak values are detected by the EDC. They may be transmitted to PC instead of an unused measuring channel. With this command the peak values for X-head position, load and extension may be configured to measuring channels in the data record. SENSOR4 to SENSOR15 are allowed to be configured as peak values. e.g. use the constant SENSOR4 for PositionMin to configure the minimum value of X-head position to SENSOR4 within the measuring data record. Any number outside SENSOR4 to SENSOR15 will reset the measuring channels to the original values. Use this feature to cancel Peak Values configuration. This command should not be used when DoPEExts2 or DoPEFDPoti command are running.
member.param: Position of Minimun value of XHead Position
Position of Maximum value of XHead Position
Position of Minimun value of Load
Position of Maximum value of Load
Position of Minimun value of Extension
Position of Maximum value of Extension

member.summary: Set reset time for peak value detection. The maximum and minimum values within this time are considered as peak values. This command should not be used when DoPEExts2 or DoPEFDPoti command are running.
member.param: Reset time for peak value detection
